description: From Middle English sorinesse, from Old English sāriġness, from Proto-West Germanic *sairaganassī, *sairīganassī; equivalent to sorry +‎ -ness. Cognate with West Frisian searigens (“soreness, tenderness”).

entries.meaning: The state or quality of being sorry; regret.

examples: His friend, Mr. Smith, thought that "a sorry farmer on a sorry farm is a sorry sight." Bill hardly attained that level of sorriness.
